content:
Sure, here are 10 more popular fashion styles for men in their late 30s:

21. Street-luxe: This style combines streetwear and luxury fashion, featuring clothing such as designer sneakers, oversized hoodies, and high-end denim.
22. Normcore: This style is characterized by a minimalistic, unassuming aesthetic, featuring clothing such as basic t-shirts, khakis, and white sneakers.
23. Workwear: This style is inspired by traditional workwear and features clothing such as denim overalls, chore coats, and heavy boots.
24. Vintage: This style is inspired by fashion trends from the past and features vintage clothing such as fedoras, suspenders, and wingtip shoes.
25. Outdoor: This style is inspired by outdoor activities and features clothing such as flannel shirts, cargo pants, and hiking boots.
26. Futuristic: This style is inspired by science fiction and features clothing such as metallic fabrics, oversized silhouettes, and bold colors.
27. Street Glam: This style is a fusion of streetwear and high-end fashion, featuring clothing such as designer denim, oversized sunglasses, and statement jewelry.
28. Relaxed Tailoring: This style is characterized by a relaxed and comfortable aesthetic, featuring tailored clothing such as unlined blazers, and soft trousers.
29. Western: This style is inspired by traditional western fashion and features clothing such as cowboy boots, denim shirts, and leather belts.
30. Street Tailoring: This style is characterized by a street-inspired aesthetic, featuring tailored clothing such as deconstructed blazers, and tapered trousers.

All these styles are popular among men in their late 30s, and you can find a style that fits your personal style, profession, and lifestyle. Remember that fashion is about expressing yourself and having fun with clothes so don't be afraid to experiment and try new things.
